abstracts.cdata!:
The Public Sector Management Project
            will help improve Ecuador's public sector management to
            make better use of scarce financial and human resources.
            The project includes several main areas of assistance which
            involve:  (i) introducing improvements in the national
            planning and budgeting systems; and (ii) supporting general
            management improvements where the state performs important
            economic activities.  The first area will be achieved by:
            (a) strengthening the macroeconomic framework for planning
            and budgeting, including better management of external debt;
            (b) improving preparation of the national budget; and (c)
            putting in place a pilot financial information system and
            training accounting professionals to use it.  It will
            further involve; (d) strengthening public investment
            monitoring; and (e) studying means for a phased reduction of
            revenue earmarking.  Subactivities within the second area
            will include:  (a) helping design a new system for
            monitoring performance of public enterprises; (b) providing
            direct assistance to key public enterprises (oil, power, and
            telephone companies) as well as to mining development
            initiatives; and (c) streamlining procurement and other
            administrative practices.
